title: Question 21
prompt: Choose the answer that is written correctly and shows the correct capitalization and punctuation. Be sure the answer you choose is complete.
feedback:
The sentence “Hong Kong is larger than Chicago” is correct. The phrase “larger than” shows a comparison between the two cities.

The sentence “Las Vegas is smallest than Seattle” incorrectly uses the word “smallest.” The word “smallest” means the most small, and is not used with the word “than” in a comparison.

The sentence “Albany is more colder than Dallas” also has an incorrect comparison. The word “more” is not used with the phrase “colder than” in a comparison.

The sentence “Los Angeles is the most large city in California” is incorrect. The phrase “most large” should instead be the word “largest.”
